pkgmetadata.longdescription: Hybrid Design for Phase I Dose-Finding Studies // The Hybrid design is a combination of model-assisted design (e.g., the modified Toxicity Probability Interval design) with dose- toxicity model-based design for phase I dose-finding studies. The hybrid design controls the overdosing toxicity well and leads to a recommended dose closer to the true maximum tolerated dose (MTD) due to its ability to calibrate for an intermediate dose. More details can be found in Liao et al. 2022 doi:10.1002/ijc.34203.
